premium.description: Bond-building treatment. Repairs damage, strengthens hair at molecular level.

mid_range.name: Nizoral Anti-Dandruff Shampoo
mid_range.description: Ketoconazole 1%. Controls flaking, scaling, itching. Dermatologist recommended.

budget.name: Sulfate-Free Shampoo & Conditioner
budget.description: Gentle cleansing. Preserves natural oils. For all hair types.

free_resources.name: How Often to Wash Hair (By Type)
free_resources.description: Oily: Every other day. Dry: 2x/week. Normal: 2-3x/week. Curly: 1x/week.

free_resources.name: Proper Hair Washing Technique
free_resources.description: Focus shampoo on scalp. Conditioner on ends only. Massage, don't scratch.

free_resources.name: Cold Water Rinse Benefits
free_resources.description: Closes cuticles, adds shine, reduces frizz. Finish with 30-second cold rinse.

free_resources.name: Hair Loss Prevention Guide
free_resources.description: Minoxidil, finasteride, derma rolling, nizoral. Evidence-based treatments.

free_resources.name: Safe Sun Exposure Guide
free_resources.description: 10-15 min before 10am or after 4pm. Face, arms exposed. 3-4x/week for Vitamin D.

free_resources.name: Circadian Rhythm Reset
free_resources.description: Morning sunlight within 30-60 min of waking. 10 min bright days, 30 min cloudy days.

free_resources.name: Huberman on Light & Circadian Health
free_resources.description: How light exposure affects sleep, mood, focus. Morning sun = evening melatonin spike.

free_resources.name: Vitamin D Testing & Supplementation
free_resources.description: Get blood test. Target: 30-50 ng/mL. Supplement 2000-4000 IU if deficient.

free_resources.name: WARNING: Sun Gazing Safety
free_resources.description: NEVER stare directly at sun. Can cause permanent retinal damage. Face sun, eyes closed or indirect gaze.

mid_range.name: Hostage Tape (Mouth Tape for Sleep)
mid_range.description: Promotes nasal breathing during sleep. Reduces snoring, improves oxygen intake.

budget.name: Medical-Grade Paper Tape
budget.description: Budget alternative. 3M Micropore tape. Gentle on skin, easy removal.

free_resources.name: James Nestor: Breath (Mouth Taping Science)
free_resources.description: Author of 'Breath' explains nasal vs mouth breathing. Why tape works.

free_resources.name: How to Safely Tape Your Mouth
free_resources.description: Start small (30 min daytime). Vertical strip across lips. Ensure nose clear. Test comfort.

free_resources.name: Nasal Breathing Benefits
free_resources.description: Filters air, warms/humidifies, produces nitric oxide (dilates blood vessels), improves O2 absorption.

free_resources.name: Buteyko Breathing Method
free_resources.description: Train nasal breathing during day. Breath hold exercises. Reduce sleep apnea symptoms.

free_resources.name: When NOT to Mouth Tape
free_resources.description: Don't tape if: nasal congestion, sleep apnea (untreated), obesity, alcohol consumption.
